item.title: Building JSX-like UI in Zig: Part 4 - Visual Internals Guide
item.description:
A visual deep-dive into the layout math, DSL ergonomics, and rendering pipeline

Introduction
#

In Parts 1-3, we built a complete JSX-like UI system. But some concepts benefit from visual explanation. This companion guide provides ASCII diagrams and step-by-step breakdowns of the trickier internals.

We’ll cover:

  1. Flexbox Math - How calcSizes distributes space
  2. Rectangle Insets - Padding and margins visually
  3. DSL Ergonomics - Why tupleToSlice exists
  4. Event Timing - Hold-to-repeat mechanics
  5. Render Pipeline - Data flow from nodes to pixels

Flexbox Math: calcSizes
#

The calcSizes function is the heart of our layout system. It solves: given a container and children (some fixed-size, some flexible), how big should each child be?
